docs.snippet: A Times reporter shadows a male speaker at a summit meeting of female political leaders in Iceland, the most gender-egalitarian country in the world.

headline.print_headline: At a Meeting of Leaders, an Outnumbered Male
headline.main: A Man Among Female Leaders: ‘The Risk of Mansplaining Is Very High’

docs.snippet: The vote amounted to a collective act of defiance toward the Trump administration at the United Nations, the world’s biggest diplomatic stage.

headline.main: A Lot Happened in the Russia Investigation on Monday. Here’s a Wrap-Up.

docs.snippet: Lam Duc-Hien, a Vietnamese photographer, first imagined Iraq to be full of tanks and violence. But after documenting the Kurdish region of Iraq for more than two decades, he found something very different.

headline.main: The Untold Quiet of Kurdish Iraq

docs.abstract: Lam Duc-Hien, a Vietnamese photographer, first imagined Iraq to be full of tanks and violence. But after documenting the Kurdish region of Iraq for more than two decades, he found something very different.

docs.snippet: A proliferation of bottles made from particular, distinctive sites has come to a region that, for years, has celebrated the art of blending.

headline.print_headline: Some Champagnes Are Going Back to the Land
headline.main: Champagne Seeks to Discover Itself in Single-Vineyard Wines
